title: How to Make Lemon Glazed Cookies

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Whisk together the flour, baking soda and salt in a large bowl.
Place the butter and sugar in another mixing bowl.
Cream the butter and sugar together using either a stand mixer with a paddle attachment or a handheld mixer.
steps.description: The mixer should be at medium-high speed. Continue beating until the mixture is pale and fluffy.

steps.headline: Add the egg and vanilla and beat for another 30 seconds.
Turn the mixer down to low speed.
steps.description: Add 1 cup of the dry ingredients and mix until the flour is incorporated into the wet ingredients.

steps.headline: Continue adding the dry ingredients in 1-cup increments until the ingredients are well combined.
Scoop the cookies using a cookie scoop or tablespoon onto the baking sheet.
steps.description: Leave 1-1/2" of space around each cookie.

steps.headline: Bake for 12 to 14 minutes until the cookies turn a light golden brown.
Remove the cookies from the oven and cool them on the stovetop for 2 minutes.
Loosen the cookies from the parchment paper with a spatula and place them on wire racks to cool.
Place the confectioner’s sugar in a sieve.
steps.description: Whisk the sugar inside the sieve, pushing it through the mesh. Discard any remaining lumps.

steps.headline: Combine the confectioner’s sugar, milk, vanilla extract, lemon juice and lemon extract in a mixing bowl and beat the mixture well with a handheld mixer or stand mixer with a paddle attachment.
steps.description: If the glaze is not thin enough, add an additional 1/2 teaspoon of milk. Continue adding milk in 1/2-teaspoon increments until the glaze has the consistency of cold honey.

steps.headline: Spread a thin layer of glaze on a cookie using a cheese spreader or a butter knife.
Return the cookie to the wire rack and allow the glaze to harden.
steps.description: The glaze should set after about 1 minute if it’s at the right consistency.

text: Prepare the Dough Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.  Whisk together the flour, baking soda and salt in a large bowl.  Place the butter and sugar in another mixing bowl.  Cream the butter and sugar together using either a stand mixer with a paddle attachment or a handheld mixer. The mixer should be at medium-high speed. Continue beating until the mixture is pale and fluffy. Add the egg and vanilla and beat for another 30 seconds.  Turn the mixer down to low speed. Add 1 cup of the dry ingredients and mix until the flour is incorporated into the wet ingredients. Continue adding the dry ingredients in 1-cup increments until the ingredients are well combined.  Bake the Cookies Scoop the cookies using a cookie scoop or tablespoon onto the baking sheet. Leave 1-1/2" of space around each cookie. Bake for 12 to 14 minutes until the cookies turn a light golden brown.  Remove the cookies from the oven and cool them on the stovetop for 2 minutes.  Loosen the cookies from the parchment paper with a spatula and place them on wire racks to cool.  Add the Glaze Place the confectioner’s sugar in a sieve. Whisk the sugar inside the sieve, pushing it through the mesh. Discard any remaining lumps. Combine the confectioner’s sugar, milk, vanilla extract, lemon juice and lemon extract in a mixing bowl and beat the mixture well with a handheld mixer or stand mixer with a paddle attachment. If the glaze is not thin enough, add an additional 1/2 teaspoon of milk. Continue adding milk in 1/2-teaspoon increments until the glaze has the consistency of cold honey. Spread a thin layer of glaze on a cookie using a cheese spreader or a butter knife.  Return the cookie to the wire rack and allow the glaze to harden. The glaze should set after about 1 minute if it’s at the right consistency. Finished.
